com.wizarpos.devices.contactlesscard
Interface ContactlessCardControl

All Superinterfaces:
DeviceControl, TimeConstants
public interface ContactlessCardControl
extends DeviceControl, TimeConstants

ContactlessCardControl defines methods available to contactless reader

This control is required by DeviceManager

ContactlessCard device is an exclusive device. It can't be opened again if it's already opened.

Version:
July 01, 2013
Author:
Haiqing Jin

Method Detail

open

void open(int logicalID,
          int mode)
          throws DeviceException
Opens the control with a specific communication mode. Targets within reader action range with incompatible mode should not be detected.

Resets the state of the initiator if it has previously been opened.

Parameters:
logicalID - logical ID of the device to open.
mode - Communication mode to use.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
  • if the logicalID is invalid.
  • if the mode is invalid.

getMode

int getMode()
            throws DeviceException
Return current communication mode.

Returns:
a constant indicating the device mode:
MODE_AUTO
MODE_NFC_PASSIVE
MODE_NFC_ACTIVE
MODE_ISO14443_TYPE_A
MODE_ISO14443_TYPE_B
MODE_ISO15693
MODE_MIFARE
MODE_FELICA
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open

addScanParam

void addScanParam(int paramID,
                  int value)
This is a synchronous method which adds parameters to help listenForScanTargets() and waitForScanTarget to find some targets. Some communication modes can use some parameters to choose only Targets matching some specified criteria:
  • Adding PARAM_SPEED will set the baud rate used during the initialization phase.
  • Adding PARAM_AFI will only select cards having a given family identifier in some mode.
  • Adding PARAM_NB_SLOT will help scan targets to better optimize communication.

Parameters will only be used by the next listenForScanTargets(OperationListener) or waitForScanTargets(int). An error may be notified with ContactlessCardOperationResult.ERR_UNSUPPORTED_PARAM, or OperationResult.control.OperationEvent#ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT in the OperationResult when operation completed.

Parameters will be implicitly cleared by open() and close().

Parameters:
paramID - Identifier defining the parameter type to add
value - Value associated with the type. Available values rely on the parameter type.
See Also:
listenForScanTargets(OperationListener), waitForScanTargets(int)

clearScanParam

void clearScanParam()
This is a synchronous method which clears all scan parameters previously added with addScanParam().

listenForScanTargets

void listenForScanTargets(OperationListener listener)
                          throws DeviceException
Starts magnetic field according to Contactless protocols and performs initialization according to the communication mode.

This is an asynchronous method. handleResult() will be invoked when at least one card has been detected in the field.

Some communication modes will always return only one Target; others may return several Targets, which may be identified by the application with ContactlessCardOperationResult.getTargets().

This method will use parameters previously added with addScanParam(). If none has been added or clearScanParam() has been called, scanTargets will behave with a typical behaviour adapted to the selected communication mode.

Information about successfully detected Targets can be retrieved by the getTargets function.

The device receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

In case of a timeout occurring, the operation event will contain status= EVT_ERROR and info= ERR_TIMEOUT, and no information about Targets will be available.

Parameters:
timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is invalid.

waitForScanTargets

ContactlessCardOperationResult waitForScanTargets(int timeout)
                                                  throws DeviceException
This is the synchronous method of the listenForScanTargets(OperationListener).

Starts magnetic field according to Contactless protocols and performs initialization according to the communication mode.

Some communication modes will always return only one Target; others may return several Targets, which may be identified by the application with ContactlessCardOperationResult.getTargets().

This method will use parameters previously added with addScanParam(). If none has been added or clearScanParam() has been called, scanTargets will behave with a typical behaviour adapted to the selected communication mode.

Because this method uses a timeout parameter, the service receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

In case of a timeout occurring, the operation event will contain status= EVT_ERROR and info= ERR_TIMEOUT, and no information about Targets will be available.

Parameters:
timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
Returns:
the Targets of scanning. null if scanning timeout.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is invalid.
